docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg plans to call on the federal government to quadruple the amount of security money it sends to New York City when he unveils the outline of his third city budget today, a mayoral aide said yesterday. Mr. Bloomberg, who has long complained that the federal government shortchanges the city on homeland security money, plans to ask for $400 million, the aide said. The city received about $100 million in such aid last year, he said.

headline.main: Mayor to Quadruple Size of Security Aid Request to Washington

docs.abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg outlines budget for New York City's coming fiscal year and says he plans to ask federal government for $400 million in homeland security money, fourfold increase (S)
